questions: A concave mirror is adjusted such that rays from the sun are obtained as a dot on a sheet of paper. It burns the paper in sometime. Choose the correct statement.
option1: Dot is real image of sun, paper burns due to concentrated sun heat.
option2: Dot is virtual image of sun, paper burns due to concentrated sun heat.
option3: Dot is real image of sun, paper burns due to high surroundings temperature.
option4: Dot is virtual image of sun, paper burns due to high surroundings temperature.

questions: Amy stands 1.5-m tall in front of a plane mirror and at a distance of 1.5 m from the mirror. Choose the right option.
option1: Amy’s image 1.5 m tall, 1.5 m behind the mirror.
option2: Amy’s image 3 m tall, 1.5 m behind the mirror
option3: Amy’s image 1.5 m tall, 1.5 m ahead of the mirror
option4: Amy’s image 3 m tall, 3 m behind the mirror

questions: Seema showed the words UNIFIED in front of a mirror. Which set of alphabets on laterally inversion seem to appear differently?
Which mirror is the dentist using to examine the teeth of the patient?
Raheem observed his image on the shiny surface of the bell of his bicycle. He found that his image was erect and smaller in size. Which type of reflecting surface the bell has?
Which of the following examples demonstrate that light is made of seven colours?
option1: Sky appears blue in the afternoon

questions: The mercury does not fall or rise in a clinical thermometer when it's taken out of the mouth. How is that possible?
option1: The kink in the thermometer does not allow mercury to fall or rise.
option2: Mercury solidifies once the thermometer is taken out of the mouth.
option3: Sudden temperature change is not sensed by mercury.

questions: Object A has a temperature of 45? while object B has a temperature of 25?. Which object will be more comfortable to touch?
Normal body temperature for a human is around 37?. Ballu has a body temperature of 40?. Based on this information, choose the correct answer.
option1: Ballu’s body will feel cooler than normal
option2: Ballu’s body will feel hotter than normal
option3: Ballu’s body will same as normal
option4: Ballu’s body will feel different at different places

questions: A clinical thermometer cannot be used for measuring the boiling point of water. What is the reason for this?
option1: The glass bulb will break at such a high temperature.
option2: Clinical thermometer has a temperature measuring range of 35? to 40?.
option3: The mercury inside the thermometer will splash.
option4: A clinical thermometer can be used to measure boiling point of water.

questions: A laboratory thermometer is used to measure the freezing point of water. When should the reading be taken?
option1: when mercury has stabilized and the thermometer is out of water.
option2: when mercury is still rising and the thermometer is out of water.
option3: when mercury has stabilized and the thermometer is still in the water.
option4: when mercury is still rising and the thermometer is in the water.

questions: A homeless person wrapped himself with a few layers of newspaper on a cold winter night to keep himself warm. Choose the correct reason.
option1: Friction between the layers of newspaper produces heat.
option2: Air trapped between the layers of newspaper is a bad conductor of heat.
option3: Newspapers are a conductor of heat.
option4: Newspaper is at a higher temperature than surroundings.

questions: Gappu and Bobo  took a wire of length 10 cm and 5 cm respectively. Both of them connected the wires in the circuit. The current flowing in both the circuits is the same. Choose the correct statement.
option1: Heat produced in both the wires will be the same.
option2: Heat will be produced only in Gappu’s wire.
option3: Heat produced in both wires will be different.
option4: Heat will be produced only in Bobo's wire.

questions:
Statement 1 - The metal tungsten has a very high melting point due to which it does not melt  
Statement 2 - Tungsten is the commonly used metal for the filament of electric bulbs.
option1: Statement 2 is the  correct reason for statement 1
option2: Statement 1 is the correct reason for statement 2
option3: Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is false
option4: Statement 2 is true but statement 1 is false

questions: Why does the bulb glow when it is switched on?
option1: Filament of the bulb becomes so hot that it glows.
option2: The glass surface of the bulb becomes bright.
option3: Filament of the bulb produces sparks of light.
option4: Bulb holder throws sparks of light inside the bulb.

questions: Curd usually takes 4-5 hours to set. What can be done to fasten the process of curd setting?
option1: Place the milk container inside the refrigerator and turn it off.
option3: Place the milk container on fire.
option4: Place a lighted bulb near the milk container.

questions: Steel wool melts when an electric current is passed through it. Which of the following appliances should use steel wool?
A type of material glows and becomes hot very quickly when an electric current is passed through it. This material is suitable for which of the following appliances?
Electromagnet 1 is made by using one cell and Electromagnet 2 is made using two cells. Everything else is the same. Which one will be a stronger electromagnet?
option3: Both will be of the same strength

questions: Vinayak travels 10 kilometers daily to school by bus. The bus takes almost 5 stops to pick students. The road always has traffic. Choose the correct option that mentions motion of the bus.

Suraj walks to his school which is at a distance of 3 km from his home in 30 minutes. On reaching he finds that the school is closed and comes back by a bicycle with his friend and reaches home in 20 minutes. His average speed in km/h is:
David travels one hour at an average speed of 45 kmph and the next hour at an average speed of 65 kmph. Then what is his average speed?
What is the distance covered by a car travelling at a speed of 40km/h in 15 minutes?
Travelling at a speed of 50kmph how long is it going to take to travel 60 km? Select all that apply.
Find the time taken to cover the distance of 360 km from Delhi to Agra, by the Shatabdi Express moving at 2 km/min.
A truck moves with a speed of 80km/hr for 15 mins and then 60km/h for the next 15 mins. How much distance has the truck covered?
When we blow over a paper strip it goes upward. Why?
option1: Blowing over the paper reduces the air pressure above the strip.
option2: Blowing over the paper increases the air pressure above the strip.
option3: Neither of these is the correct reason.
option4: The strip will not go upward at all.

questions: To expel hot air out of the kitchen, ‘A’ has an exhaust fan fitted on the window of her kitchen and ‘B’ has a similar exhaust fan fitted on the wall near the ceiling of kitchen. Which of the exhaust fans will expel the hot air more effectively?
Curtain is hanging at the entrance of a room. A long corridor runs at right angles to the door, that is parallel to the curtain. If a strong wind blows along the corridor, the curtain will:
When a plastic bottle containing some hot water is closed and cold water is poured on it, the bottle changes its shape. Why?
option1: Outside air pressure is more than  inside the bottle
option2: Outside air pressure is less than inside the bottle
option3: Outside air pressure is equal to the  inside the bottle
option4: Plastic bottle must have been faulty

questions: A flat in Mumbai with a balcony facing the sea has some clothes hung in the balcony. Towards which direction will the clothes be blown in the afternoon?
Which of the following latitude belts shows movement of cooler air towards the region close to the equator?
